Marketing
has
evolved
widely
over
the
years,
from
radio
ads
with
just
audio
to
print
advertisements
and
now
an
entirely
digital
era.
With
Valentine's
Week
in
full
swing,
multiple
brands
are
launching
creative
marketing
campaigns,
as
it
is
known
to
be
the
peak
season
for
gifting.
One
campaign
that
stood
out
to
me
was
a
unique
print
ad
in
The
Times
of
India
by
Fabelle
Chocolates
that
I
saw
yesterday.
At
first
glance,
the
ad
appeared
quite
minimalistic,
but
it
featured
a
QR
code
that,
when
scanned,
unlocked
a
great
VR
experience.
This
campaign
was
innovative
and
also
perfectly
aligned
with
their
brand
messaging.
The
ad
had
royalty,
luxury,
and
premium
appeal
in
every
aspect.
Shoutout
to
the
copywriter
who
thought
of
the
sweet
and
witty
one-liners
for
each
element.
Chocolates
and
Valentine‚Äôs
Day
are
inseparable,
and
introducing
such
an
interactive
concept
while
highlighting
flavours
inspired
by
nature
is
a
smart
move:
earth,
water,
fire,
air
and
space.
While
reading
the
article
states
having
a
sensorial
taste
with
each
bite
and
honestly,
with
ingredients
like
Acacia
Nectar,
French
Sea
Salt,
Candied
Mango,
and
Ancho
Chilli
I
don't
doubt
them.
Promoting
premium
products
is
always
a
challenge,
but
leveraging
advanced
VR
marketing
would
help
this
campaign
gain
more
traction.I
know
for
sure
my
team
and
I
would
love
to
get
our
hands
on
this!
hashtag#FabelleChocolate
hashtag#ValentinesIndulgence
hashtag#LuxuryInEveryBite
hashtag#marketing

to

for

üôå
Most

after

also

to

Now

Whatever

all,

in

or

other
üòá

Quick
commerce
has
transformed
the
way
we
shop.
It
has
over
25
million
active
users
who
rely
on
it
for
essentials
as
it
delivers
super
quickly.
This
was
all
made
possible
by
modern
technology,
particularly
AI-powered
algorithms,
advanced
data
management,
and
streamlined
customer
support
systems.For
someone
like
me,
living
alone,
access
to
medications
and
healthcare
essentials
is
a
top
priority.
Apollo
24|7
has
addressed
this
need
by
bringing
multiple
healthcare
services
together
on
one
platform.
It
delivers
medicines
within
19-29
minutes
in
6+
cities
and
also
offers
online
doctor
consultations
with
other
medical
services.
Also,
their
Circle
Membership
adds
a
lot
of
value
with
its
benefits.It‚Äôs
great
to
see
them
make
such
meaningful
contributions
to
society
while
achieving
excellent
growth
under
innovative
leadership.
hashtag#healthcare
hashtag#technology
hashtag#19minutes
hashtag#Partnership

Five
years
ago,
I
started
with
‚Çπ2500
for
3
to
3.5
hours
of
continuous
teaching
sessions
before
I
had
my
YT
for
an
edtech.
For
about
a
year,
I
was
teaching
for
9‚Äì10
hours
on
Saturdays
and
Sundays
as
well.
This
eventually
took
a
toll
on
my
health,
leading
to
a
neck
surgery
(the
scar
you
see
on
my
neck
is
a
reminder
of
that).The
last
online
paid
teaching
session
I
conducted
was
a
couple
of
years
ago,
for
‚Çπ75,000
per
hour.
Since
then,
I
have
focused
exclusively
on
being
available
through
my
platform
takeUforward.
Remember,
no
starting
point
is
too
small.
With
the
right
mindset
and
skills,
you
will
eventually
achieve
success,
it
can
be
any
profession.I
take
bi-weekly
sessions
on
TUF+
platform
where
all
of
us
connect
usually:
takeuforward.org/plus
